name: Serbia
description: Serbia, officially the Republic of Serbia, is a landlocked country in Southeastern Europe. It boasts a rich history, diverse landscapes ranging from the Carpathian Mountains in the north to the Pannonian Plain in the south, and a vibrant culture influenced by various empires and civilizations. The country is known for its fertile plains, numerous rivers, and significant archaeological sites.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital and largest city of Serbia.
quickFacts.detail: Belgrade is situated on the confluence of the Sava and Danube rivers, a strategic location that has shaped its history.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population identifies as Serbian, with significant minorities including Romani, Hungarian, and Albanian communities.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Serbia covers an area of 77,975 square kilometers.
quickFacts.detail: It is bordered by Hungary to the northwest, Romania to the southwest, Bulgaria to the west, North Macedonia to the southwest, Bosnia and Herzegovina to the south, and Montenegro to the southeast.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The official currency of Serbia is the Serbian Dinar.
quickFacts.detail: The exchange rate fluctuates, but generally, 1 EUR is approximately 130 RSD.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: Serbian is a South Slavic language with distinct dialects.  Croatian, Macedonian, and Bosnian are mutually intelligible to varying degrees.

climateData.title: Climate of Serbia
climateData.description: Serbia experiences a continental climate with hot summers and cold winters. Rainfall is distributed relatively evenly throughout the year, though mountainous regions receive more precipitation.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual warming, with blossoming trees and wildflowers transforming the landscape.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is hot and dry, with temperatures often exceeding 30°C (86°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn is characterized by cooler temperatures and vibrant foliage, particularly in the mountainous regions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is cold and snowy, especially in the northern and mountainous areas.  Southern Serbia experiences milder winters.

naturalWonders.name: Tara National Park
naturalWonders.description: Tara National Park is a stunning mountainous region in eastern Serbia, renowned for its dramatic canyons, dense forests, and diverse wildlife. It's a haven for hikers and nature enthusiasts.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The Drina River carves a deep canyon through the park, creating breathtaking views. The Biogradska Gora National Park, one of Europe's last virgin forests, is also located within Tara.

naturalWonders.name: Djerdap National Park (Iron Gate)
naturalWonders.description: Djerdap National Park encompasses the Iron Gate gorge, where the Danube and Sava rivers meet. It's a spectacular landscape of cliffs, rapids, and historical sites.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The park is home to a variety of flora and fauna, including rare bird species. The Golubac Fortress, a medieval stronghold, is a prominent landmark within the park.
viewingTips: Take a boat tour to explore the gorge

naturalWonders.name: Stara Planina (Old Mountain)
naturalWonders.description: Stara Planina, also known as the Old Mountain, stretches across central Serbia, offering a diverse landscape of forests, meadows, and rocky peaks.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountain is rich in historical sites, including ancient Thracian settlements and medieval monasteries. It's a popular destination for hiking, skiing, and wildlife observation.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Serbia
ecosystemData.overview: Serbia's ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from the fertile plains of the Pannonian Basin to the rugged mountains of the Balkan Peninsula. These ecosystems support a rich array of flora and fauna, including several endangered species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Serbia's forests cover approximately 30% of the country's land area, providing habitat for a wide range of species.

statistics.details: Diverse species including beech, oak, and fir.
Remaining areas of pristine, untouched forests.

notableSpecies.name: Brown Bear
notableSpecies.significance: A keystone species in the mountain ecosystems.

biodiversityCategories.name: Rivers and Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Serbia's rivers and wetlands are vital habitats for fish, birds, and amphibians.

statistics.details: Numerous rivers flowing into the Danube and Sava.
Important breeding grounds for migratory birds.

notableSpecies.name: European Sturgeon
notableSpecies.significance: A migratory fish of great ecological importance.

notableSpecies.name: White Pelican
notableSpecies.significance: A large bird that relies on wetlands for breeding.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Serbia
activities.description: Serbia offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from hiking and cycling to water sports and skiing.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Serbia's diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Tara National Park Hiking
activities.description: Hike through the stunning canyons and forests of Tara National Park.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, water, snacks, map

activities.name: Stara Planina Hiking
activities.description: Hike to the mountain peaks and explore the historical sites of Stara Planina.
activities.requirements: Hiking boots, layers of clothing, water, sunscreen

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the rivers and lakes of Serbia with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Danube River Rafting
activities.description: Raft down the scenic Danube River.
activities.requirements: Life jacket, helmet, wetsuit (depending on water temperature)

activities.name: Lake Čerdin Water Skiing
activities.description: Water ski on the clear waters of Lake Čerdin.

clothing.winter: Warm coat, hat, gloves, scarf, waterproof boots

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
